window.Help: The Process Payments Window allows you to enter payments and reaipts for invoices. If the payment is for a single invoice then it can be processed here. If it is for multiple invoices or is a partial payment then it should be processed in the Payment Allocation Window.
window.Name: Payment

element.Description: The record is active in the system
element.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
element.Name: Active

column.Description: The record is active in the system
column.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
column.Name: Active

element.Description: Document sequence number of the document
element.Help:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
element.Name: Document No

column.Description: Document sequence number of the document
column.Help:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
column.Name: Document No

element.Help: The Charge indicates a type of Charge (Handling, Shipping, Restocking)
element.Name: Charge

dynvalrule.Name: C_Charge by Doc Type
dynvalrule.Code: (C_Charge.C_Charge_ID IN ( SELECT c.C_Charge_ID FROM C_Charge c JOIN C_ChargeType ct ON (ct.C_ChargeType_ID = c.C_ChargeType_ID) JOIN C_ChargeType_Doctype ctd ON (ctd.C_ChargeType_ID = ct.C_ChargeType_ID) JOIN C_DocType dt ON (dt.C_DocType_ID =ctd.C_DocType_ID) WHERE ctd.C_DocType_ID = @C_DocType_ID@ ) OR (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM C_ChargeType_DocType WHERE AD_Client_ID=@AD_Client_ID@) = 0)

column.Help: The Charge indicates a type of Charge (Handling, Shipping, Restocking)
column.Name: Charge

element.Help: The Order is a control document. The Order is complete when the quantity ordered is the same as the quantity shipped and invoiced. When you close an order, unshipped (backordered) quantities are cancelled.
element.Name: Order
element.PO_Help: The Purchase Order is a control document. The Purchase Order is complete when the quantity ordered is the same as the quantity shipped and invoiced. When you close an order, unshipped (backordered) quantities are cancelled.

dynvalrule.Name: C_Order in Payment
dynvalrule.Code: (C_Order.DocStatus='WP' OR (C_Order.DocStatus='CO' AND EXISTS (SELECT * FROM C_DocType dt WHERE C_Order.C_DocType_ID=dt.C_DocType_ID AND (dt.DocSubTypeSO='SO' OR dt.DocBaseType='POO')) AND EXISTS (SELECT * FROM C_OrderLine ol WHERE C_Order.C_Order_ID=ol.C_Order_ID AND ol.QtyInvoiced<>ol.QtyOrdered)))
dynvalrule.Description: Waiting Payment or Standard Order with ininvoiced lines

column.Help: The Order is a control document. The Order is complete when the quantity ordered is the same as the quantity shipped and invoiced. When you close an order, unshipped (backordered) quantities are cancelled.
column.Name: Order

tab.Name: Payment
tab.Help:
Enter payment or receipt for a Business Partner. If it is for a single invoice it can be allocated directly to that invoice using this screen. You can also apply over/under payments:
You have an over-payment, if you received more money than due for a single invoice. Instead of writing the difference off (i.e. would be a gain), you can leave the amount unallocated and use it for later invoices or credit memos. Please note that the Amount is the payment amount, so you need to enter the over-payment as a negative amount.
You can also receive a partial payment (under-payment). If you decide not to write off the remaining invoice amount, enter the under-payment as a positive amount.
Note that printed payments are archived in Payment Selection (Prepared Payment).
For Posting, the bank account organization is used, if it is not a charge.
tab.WhereClause: C_Payment.C_BPartner_ID IS NOT NULL AND C_Payment.IsReceipt = 'N'

field.Name: Payment
field.Help: The Payment is a unique identifier of this payment.

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

field.Name: Reconciled
field.Description: Payment is reconciled with bank statement

field.Name: Processed
field.Help: The Processed checkbox indicates that a document has been processed.

field.Name: Info
field.Help: The Info indicates any response information returned from the Credit Card Company.

field.Help: The Partner Bank Account identifies the bank account to be used for this Business Partner

field.Name: Payment Batch

field.Help: Delayed Capture is required, if you ship products. The first credit card transaction is the Authorization, the second is the actual transaction after the shipment of the product.

field.Name: Charge amount
field.Help: The Charge Amount indicates the amount for an additional charge.

field.Name: Authorization Code (DC)
field.Help: The Authorization Code indicates the code returned from the electronic transmission.

field.Name: Client
field.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.

field.Name: Organization
field.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

field.Name: Document No
field.Description: Document sequence number of the document
field.Help:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

field.Name: Bank Account
field.Help: The Bank Account identifies an account at this Bank.

field.Name: Document Type
field.Help: The Document Type determines document sequence and processing rules

field.Name: Transaction Date
field.Help: The Transaction Date indicates the date of the transaction.

field.Name: Account Date
field.Help: The Accounting Date indicates the date to be used on the General Ledger account entries generated from this document. It is also used for any currency conversion.

field.Name: Description
field.Description: Optional short description of the record
field.Help: A description is limited to 255 characters.

field.Name: Business Partner
field.Help: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

field.Name: Invoice
field.Help: The Invoice Document.

field.Name: Order
field.Help: The Order is a control document. The Order is complete when the quantity ordered is the same as the quantity shipped and invoiced. When you close an order, unshipped (backordered) quantities are cancelled.

field.Name: Project
field.Help: A Project allows you to track and control internal or external activities.

field.Name: Charge
field.Help: The Charge indicates a type of Charge (Handling, Shipping, Restocking)

field.Name: Prepayment
field.Help: Payments not allocated to an invoice with a charge are posted to Unallocated Payments. When setting this flag, the payment is posted to the Customer or Vendor Prepayment account.

field.Name: Activity
field.Help: Activities indicate tasks that are performed and used to utilize Activity based Costing

field.Name: Campaign
field.Help: The Campaign defines a unique marketing program. Projects can be associated with a pre defined Marketing Campaign. You can then report based on a specific Campaign.

field.Name: Trx Organization
field.Help: The organization which performs or initiates this transaction (for another organization). The owning Organization may not be the transaction organization in a service bureau environment, with centralized services, and inter-organization transactions.

field.Name: User List 1
field.Help: The user defined element displays the optional elements that have been defined for this account combination.

field.Name: User List 2
field.Help: The user defined element displays the optional elements that have been defined for this account combination.

field.Name: Payment amount
field.Help: Indicates the amount this payment is for. The payment amount can be for single or multiple invoices or a partial payment for an invoice.

field.Name: Currency
field.Help: Indicates the Currency to be used when processing or reporting on this record

field.Name: Currency Type
field.Help: The Currency Conversion Rate Type lets you define different type of rates, e.g. Spot, Corporate and/or Sell/Buy rates.

field.Name: Discount Amount
field.Help: The Discount Amount indicates the discount amount for a document or line.

field.Name: Write-off Amount
field.Help: The Write Off Amount indicates the amount to be written off as uncollectible.

field.Name: Over/Under Payment
field.Help: Overpayments (negative) are unallocated amounts and allow you to receive money for more than the particular invoice. Underpayments (positive) is a partial payment for the invoice. You do not write off the unpaid amount.

field.Name: Over/Under Payment
field.Help: Overpayments (negative) are unallocated amounts and allow you to receive money for more than the particular invoice. Underpayments (positive) is a partial payment for the invoice. You do not write off the unpaid amount.

field.Name: Tender type
field.Help: The Tender Type indicates the method of payment (ACH or Direct Deposit, Credit Card, Check, Direct Debit)

field.Name: Online Access
field.Help: The Online Access check box indicates if the application can be accessed via the web.

field.Name: Routing No
field.Help: The Bank Routing Number (ABA Number) identifies a legal Bank. It is used in routing checks and electronic transactions.

field.Name: Account No
field.Help: The Account Number indicates the Number assigned to this bank account.

field.Name: Check No
field.Help: The Check Number indicates the number on the check.

field.Name: Micr
field.Description: Combination of routing no, account and check no
field.Help: The Micr number is the combination of the bank routing number, account number and check number

field.Name: Credit Card
field.Help: The Credit Card drop down list box is used for selecting the type of Credit Card presented for payment.

field.Name: Transaction Type
field.Help: The Transaction Type indicates the type of transaction to be submitted to the Credit Card Company.

field.Name: Number
field.Help: The Credit Card number indicates the number on the credit card, without blanks or spaces.

field.Name: Verification Code
field.Description: Credit Card Verification code on credit card
field.Help: The Credit Card Verification indicates the verification code on the credit card (AMEX 4 digits on front; MC,Visa 3 digits back)

field.Name: Exp. Month
field.Help: The Expiry Month indicates the expiry month for this credit card.

field.Name: Exp. Year
field.Help: The Expiry Year indicates the expiry year for this credit card.

field.Name: Account Name
field.Description: Name on Credit Card or Account holder
field.Help: The Name of the Credit Card or Account holder.

field.Name: Account Street
field.Description: Street address of the Credit Card or Account holder
field.Help: The Street Address of the Credit Card or Account holder.

field.Name: Account City
field.Description: City or the Credit Card or Account Holder
field.Help: The Account City indicates the City of the Credit Card or Account holder

field.Name: Account Zip/Postal
field.Description: Zip Code of the Credit Card or Account Holder
field.Help: The Zip Code of the Credit Card or Account Holder.

field.Name: Account State
field.Description: State of the Credit Card or Account holder
field.Help: The State of the Credit Card or Account holder

field.Name: Account Country
field.Help: Account Country Name

field.Name: Driver License
field.Help: The Driver's License being used as identification.

field.Name: Social Security No
field.Help: The Social Security number being used as identification.

field.Name: Account EMail
field.Help: The EMail Address indicates the EMail address off the Credit Card or Account holder.

field.Name: Tax Amount
field.Description: Tax Amount for Credit Card transaction
field.Help: The Tax Amount displays the total tax amount. The tax amount is only used for credit card processing.

field.Name: PO Number
field.Help: The PO Number indicates the number assigned to a purchase order

field.Name: Voice authorization code
field.Description: Voice Authorization Code from credit card company
field.Help: The Voice Authorization Code indicates the code received from the Credit Card Company.

field.Name: Original Transaction ID
field.Help: The Original Transaction ID is used for reversing transactions and indicates the transaction that has been reversed.

field.Name: Approved
field.Description: Indicates if this document requires approval
field.Help: The Approved checkbox indicates if this document requires approval before it can be processed.

field.Name: Result
field.Help: The Response Result indicates the result of the transmission to the Credit Card Company.

field.Name: Response Message
field.Help: The Response Message indicates the message returned from the Credit Card Company as the result of a transmission

field.Name: Reference
field.Help: The Payment Reference indicates the reference returned from the Credit Card Company for a payment

field.Name: Authorization Code
field.Help: The Authorization Code indicates the code returned from the electronic transmission.

field.Name: Zip verified
field.Description: The Zip Code has been verified
field.Help: The Zip Verified indicates if the zip code has been verified by the Credit Card Company.

field.Name: Address verified
field.Help: The Address Verified indicates if the address has been verified by the Credit Card Company.

field.Name: Document Status
field.Description: The current status of the document
field.Help: The Document Status indicates the status of a document at this time. If you want to change the document status, use the Document Action field

field.Name: Self-Service
field.Description: This is a Self-Service entry or this entry can be changed via Self-Service
field.Help: Self-Service allows users to enter data or update their data. The flag indicates, that this record was entered or created via Self-Service or that the user can change it via the Self-Service functionality.

field.Name: Posted
field.Help: The Posted field indicates the status of the Generation of General Ledger Accounting Lines

field.Name: Allocated
field.Description: Indicates if the payment has been allocated
field.Help: The Allocated checkbox indicates if a payment has been allocated or associated with an invoice or invoices.

field.Name: Cash Book
field.Description: Cash Book for recording petty cash transactions
field.Help: The Cash Book identifies a unique cash book. The cash book is used to record cash transactions.

element.Help: You can directly allocate payments to invoices when creating the Payment. Note that you can over- or under-allocate the payment. When processing the payment, the allocation is created.
element.Name: Allocate Payment

column.Help: You can directly allocate payments to invoices when creating the Payment. Note that you can over- or under-allocate the payment. When processing the payment, the allocation is created.
column.Name: Allocate Payment

column.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.
column.Name: Client

column.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.
column.Name: Organization

column.Description: The record is active in the system
column.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
column.Name: Active

column.Help: The Created field indicates the date that this record was created.
column.Name: Created

column.Help: The Created By field indicates the user who created this record.
column.Name: Created By

column.Help: The Updated field indicates the date that this record was updated.
column.Name: Updated

column.Help: The Updated By field indicates the user who updated this record.
column.Name: Updated By

column.Help: The Payment is a unique identifier of this payment.
column.Name: Payment

dynvalrule.Name: C_Invoice of Payment
dynvalrule.Code: C_Invoice.DocStatus IN ('CO', 'CL') AND C_Invoice.C_Currency_ID=@C_Currency_ID@ AND C_Invoice.C_BPartner_ID=@C_BPartner_ID@ AND C_Invoice.IsSOTrx='@IsReceipt@'

column.Help: The Invoice Document.
column.Name: Invoice

element.Help: The Amount indicates the amount for this document line.
element.Name: Amount

column.Help: The Amount indicates the amount for this document line.
column.Name: Amount

column.Help: The Discount Amount indicates the discount amount for a document or line.
column.Name: Discount Amount

column.Help: The Write Off Amount indicates the amount to be written off as uncollectible.
column.Name: Write-off Amount

column.Help: Overpayments (negative) are unallocated amounts and allow you to receive money for more than the particular invoice. Underpayments (positive) is a partial payment for the invoice. You do not write off the unpaid amount.
column.Name: Over/Under Payment

element.Help: Allocation of Cash/Payment to Invoice
element.Name: Allocation Line

column.Help: Allocation of Cash/Payment to Invoice
column.Name: Allocation Line

column.ColumnSQL: (SELECT MAX(p.PayAmt)-COALESCE(SUM(a.Amount),0) FROM C_Payment p LEFT OUTER JOIN C_PaymentAllocate a ON (p.C_Payment_ID=a.C_Payment_ID) WHERE p.C_Payment_ID=C_PaymentAllocate.C_Payment_ID)
column.DefaultValue: @SQL=SELECT MAX(p.PayAmt)-COALESCE(SUM(a.Amount),0) FROM C_Payment p LEFT OUTER JOIN C_PaymentAllocate a ON (p.C_Payment_ID=a.C_Payment_ID) WHERE p.C_Payment_ID=@C_Payment_ID@
column.Name: Remaining Amt

tab.Name: Allocate
tab.Help: You can directly allocate payments to invoices with the same currency when creating the Payment. Note that you can over- or under-allocate the payment.<b> When processing the payment, the allocation is created.<b> The Organization is set to the invoice organization

field.Name: Allocate Payment
field.Help: You can directly allocate payments to invoices when creating the Payment. Note that you can over- or under-allocate the payment. When processing the payment, the allocation is created.

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
